definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Inview of the practical need of society, there are more and more people interested in learning English.
sentences.chinese: 鉴于社会的需要，愈来愈多人对学英语有兴趣。

sentences.english: The tree grew taller and taller.
sentences.chinese: 那棵树长得愈来愈高了。

sentences.english: Implant supported denture has been more and more often used to restore the loosing teeth.
sentences.chinese: 种植义齿愈来愈多应用于口腔修复领域。

sentences.english: Gary and I saw eair conditionersh other less and fewer.
sentences.chinese: 我和葛瑞相互见面的机会愈来愈少。

sentences.english: Things are looking bluer than ever for us.
sentences.chinese: 情况对我们愈来愈不妙了。

sentences.english: They had found the early tiffs become more frequent.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现早期的小争执愈来愈频繁。

sentences.english: Many students spend less and less time studying after going to college.
sentences.chinese: 许多学生上了大学后念书的时间愈来愈少。

sentences.english: Help us grow into the likeness of Jesus, who loves you perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 求祢使我们愈来愈像耶稣，那样完全地爱祢。

sentences.english: More and more people are forgetting the saying, "Pride comes before a fall."
sentences.chinese: 有愈来愈多的人忘记了“骄者必败”这句俗话。

sentences.english: Gary and I saw each other less and less.
sentences.chinese: 我和葛瑞彼此见面的机遇愈来愈少。

sentences.english: The stellar wind carries ever less mass at ever increasing speed.
sentences.chinese: 恒星风所运载出的质量愈来愈少，使其速度愈来愈快。

sentences.english: The stellar wind carries ever less mass at ever increasing speed.
sentences.chinese: 恒星风所运载出的质量愈来愈少，使其速度愈来愈快。

sentences.english: Their quarreling bego louder or louder.
sentences.chinese: 她们的争吵声愈来愈大。

sentences.english: There will be less and less space for wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 对野生生物来说空间将愈来愈少。

sentences.english: Today, more and more power-control functions are partly or completely digital.
sentences.chinese: 如今，愈来愈多的电源控制功能已部分或完全数位化。

sentences.english: More and more people are inclining toward the Liberal Party.
sentences.chinese: 愈来愈多的人倾向于自由党了。

definition: increasingly/more and more/ever more/all the more
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
increasingly/more and more/ever more/all the more
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
to become more and more/to gradually become
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to increase without letup/to get worse and worse (idiom)
(of time) to elapse or pass/(of a situation) to develop or evolve
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
